attributes.action: A tenant should not be evicted, after expiry of the tenancy without any reason.
attributes.background: A tenant usually sign tenancy agreement for 12 months, but after the expiry of the tenancy agreement, landlord issues him 2 month's Section 21 Notice and evict him by county court order. This destroys the family life of the tenant. He needs to struggle again to establish a normal family life.

attributes.action: Bring in informed consent legislation for elections and referendums.
attributes.background: It is currently legal for political bodies to use false or misleading information in the run up to a vote. Introducing Free, Prior, Informed Consent(FPIC) legislation for elections would hold politicians accountable for misleading or manipulating voters as well as make sure people are aware of risks
attributes.additional_details: Many voters have said they did not fully understand the EU referendum. Politicians used false figures and misleading information in official campaigns to manipulate voters’ decisions. This impinges on voters’ right to self-determination, because they were not fully informed. There is legislation to protect the same rights in other professions, there should also be similar ones for politics and government.

attributes.action: A highly experienced business figure should lead UK exit negotiations with EU
attributes.background: Given the extreme importance of negotiating the best possible exit for the UK from the EU, the government should employ the services of a highly experienced, independent business figure to lead & manage the negotiations. We need the best person for the job who is unlikely to be a politician.

attributes.action: To review spent criminal convictions on a dbs after 10 years have elapsed.
attributes.background:
I was convicted 15 years ago of possession with intent to supply cannabis. 
I served my community service order and have never or will never re-offend.
The problem I have know is this will always show on a dbs disclosure and has stopped me, in some cases having a good career.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst I understand certain convictions should remain on a dbs disclosure permanently, my view is that a lot of people deserve a bona fide second chance. 
A wiping of the slate clean so to speak. I don't want myself and probably many others to keep on getting refused the chance to do better for themselves and their families because of a mistake they've made many years ago and have properly rehabilitated from. 
I urge the government to seriously consider this and let genuinely remorseful people move on.

attributes.action: Free prescription charges for, Spondylitis/Fibromyalgia/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
attributes.background: Spondylitis/Fibromyalgia/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome are auto-immune diseases effecting more than 500,000 people in the UK. Currently there is no cure, so the only way to manage the pain and flare up's is to take medication, taking 20 tablets+ daily.
attributes.additional_details: I am petitioning for, any Spondylitis/Fibromyalgia/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome/Lupus sufferers to be given free prescriptions and and all above named conditions be added to the NHS exemption list. These conditions can affect any of us, no matter what age. Having to pay for prescriptions or prescription-pre-payment cards till you are 60 is not fair, they need to be added to the medical exemption format.

attributes.action: Allow Tunbridge Wells a referendum to separate from the UK alongside Scotland.
attributes.background:
Tunbridge Wells voted in favour of remaining as part of the EU against the trend of the rest of the country.

Please allow Tunbridge Wells an independence referendum (along the lines of the inevitable Scottish Referendum for independence) so that it can renegotiate itself back into the EU.

attributes.action: Poll Leave the EU Voters their reasons and present this to the EU before Brexit.
attributes.background: Anti-EU sentiment is not exclusive to the UK. With a Brexit, it is clear the EU will need to implement reforms to prevent other Nations from following suit. Why wait for the UK to leave the EU before reforming? Poll those who voted Leave for their reasons (it is currently not clear). Present these.
attributes.additional_details:
The EU should use this poll result of Leave voters to present reforms. The UK can then vote again that with these reforms, do we still want to leave the EU? 

Some may argue that David Cameron already asked for reforms. However, it is clear few really actually believed the UK would vote to leave. Now that it is clear, ask why the people voted this way and the EU should present new reforms. 

EU reforms will need to come. The EU has the chance now to do so before a Brexit actually happens.

attributes.action: Propose a referendum on whether or not HM Government should trigger Article 50.
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum and the fact UK citizens can now see it's effect more clearly and are better informed of future plans, we the undersigned propose HM Government hold a further referendum on whether or not to trigger Article50. The result of this should then determine a 2nd referendum.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is due to the sheer number of people expressing they voted incorrectly to leave, some as a "dissatisfaction" vote and the fact the vote was too close to be a satisfactory result. Also the backtracking on spending proposals (eg NHS) clearly left many feeling deceived by the out campaign. UK citizens deserve honesty and integrity from their leaders to make truely informed decisions and that did not happen.

attributes.action: Give young people of 13 years and over the right to vote in referenda.
attributes.background: I am 13.  People of my age will have to live with the decisions that adults made for us for years to come.  We need a say.  Young people are just as engaged as adults.  We have access to social media and information, and we take it in.  We want to secure our own futures.

attributes.action: Require all health&beauty products to show if they are/aren't tested on animals.
attributes.background: Many household and health & beauty are tested on animals, but usually these products do not state that they are. This should be a requirement because animal testing is a horrid thing and many people are mislead to think they are buying cruelty free.

attributes.action: Raise the age of voting to 25
attributes.background: It would appear that too many young people between the ages of 18 and 25 are being persuaded about their political decisions by uneducated pop stars and celebrities. therefore only persons over 25 should have the political mandate.
attributes.additional_details:
Bob Geldorf, had a few hit records and now extols the advantages of remaining in the EU. With no expertise in how the EU works or any political office of his own. is also not a British citizen

Bono, had some hit records and now extols the advantages of remaining in the EU. With no expertise in how the EU works or any political office of his own. is also not a British citizen

attributes.action: Increase NHS and science research funding by £350 million per week
attributes.background: The leave campaign promised to redirect the money spent on EU membership to UK priorities, such as NHS and science funding. They should honour this promise, and increase funding for the NHS and science research by £350 million per week, which is what is spent by the UK on EU membership.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.voteleavetakecontrol.org/campaign - evidence that voters were promised increased funding for the NHS and science research by the leave campaign.

attributes.action: Referendum on making London a principality with right to remain in the EU
attributes.background: Following the overwhelming support from London voters for the UK to remain in the EU, we request that HM Government consider the option to allow London (as a principality of the U.K.) to remain in the EU - if necessary, following a second referendum/London-only vote.

attributes.action: Make London, Northern Ireland and Scotland an independent EU state.
attributes.background: The Majority of Scotland, Northern Ireland and London have voted to remain in the UK. So I ask Parliament to hold a referendum to make London Northern Ireland and Scotland a separate state of the European Union.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence as per EU Referendum results in press.

attributes.action: Bristol to receive a referendum to leave the UK and form an independent Nation
attributes.background: After vote leave won we believe that the United Kingdom does not speak or represent Bristol anymore and believe it better to move in a different direction from the UK

attributes.action: Call for an enquiry into false claims & advertising used in the EU Referendum
attributes.background: Both sides used false advertising and claims during the EU Referendum. It made for a completely confusing debate and made it extremely hard for the electorate to follow, and therefore tough to make an informed decision.

attributes.action: A referendum for Independence for London, and the South East England Counties.
attributes.background: On the 23rd of June 2016 the United Kingdom voted to leave the EU. London & South East of England thrive on European trade and intrinsic links to global wealth and trade that it brings.
attributes.additional_details: On the 23rd of June 2016 the United Kingdom held a referendum to on Europe. The local economies of "L&SE" (London and the South East) are driven by our intrinsic links to global trade and global wealth, and services to be provided around this. The EU is a vital component of these links.

attributes.action: Free swimming concessions for elderly on a national basis.
attributes.background: To increase health and activity of older population at all public pools . Older people have limited income so free swimming would encourage healthier lifestyle.  Pools are paid out of council tax so should benifit local elderly .

attributes.action: No confidence in the Government's Naval Strategy
attributes.background:
The Government should increase the effectiveness of the Royal Navy by designing and building the fleet into a credible and efficient navy by reducing the colossal waste and inefficiency in defence procurement.
We need to change the Royal Navy into an effective navy that can be fit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details:
We the undersigned via this petition wish to show our dismay with the Government’s naval strategy, caused by underfunding, resulting in new ships unfit for purpose, delays in building the Type 26 Frigate and overspends on other projects.
More money should be allocated to the naval budget by reducing the amount spent on foreign aid”

attributes.action: Force childcare providers to cap escalating and over priced childcare costs
attributes.background: Since my son has been in private nursery, we have paid £14000. My son has been in nursery for 13 months! Over the course of two years, we would have paid £25000 which is enough for a deposit on a house. This is obscene and believe that childcare should be capped to no more than £45 per day.
attributes.additional_details: Not only do parents have to pay for bank holidays but also for family holidays making it near impossible to go on holiday for some families. Many parents earn nothing after paying childcare fees but yet we are urged to work. With some childcare providers charging in excess of £90 per day, how are we supposed to pay these costs?

attributes.action: Introduce retrospective legislation offering protection to company pension funds
attributes.background: Philip Green purchased BHS in 2000. Since then he has reportedly extracted £580M from the company, driving it to bankruptcy. Meanwhile there is a £571M shortfall in the pension fund affecting thousands of workers. This is a morally reprehensible situation that should be rectified.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory that offenders convicted of domestic violence attend a course.
attributes.background:
According to the Office of National Statistics, over 42% of the 
UK population (28% women and 15% men) have experienced some form of domestic abuse in their lives between the age of 16 - 65.
There has been an increase from 1.7 million people in 2012 to 
1.9 million convicted in 2014/2015.
attributes.additional_details: There is  'NO EXCUSE for ABUSE'  in any relationship.  It has become  pressingly urgent to stop the increase of domestic abuse.   We are all entitled to the equal protection of the Law.  The matter should be raised in Parliament (especially taking into consideration the House of Commons  report February 2016) defining the issues.  We want to reduce domestic abuse by 60%, in the next 10 years, by making it compulsory for offenders to attend a mandatory course, "Raising Awareness Workshops" .

attributes.action: Publish all UK accounts in regard to EU & the Commons debate & scrutinise them.
attributes.background:
To make an informed decision at the referendum
I need to see with immediate effect all the UK accounts & contractual documents in regard to the EEC/EU
This will include all monies etc going to or from the EU
AND
all monies etc given out in the UK listing exactly without exception all recipients.
attributes.additional_details:
The complete accounts & documents to be openly published on the Government website.
The EU have failed to openly publish their accounts for over 18 years
& report said money is lost in corruption.
I am sick of hearing both sides referring to reports that are not always independent.
A full open audit will expose the truth & facts.

Without this evidence
As with any contract unless I can read & consider the terms & conditions then I will refuse to sign it.
In this case I will Vote to Leave the EU.

attributes.action: Create a separate loan that caters for accommodation for university students
attributes.background: Many student loans barely cover the cost of accommodation, so how will students from low income families go to the university of their choice when accommodation is more than the loan they are entitled to? This leaves many students in a deficit before they've even paid for anything.
attributes.additional_details: With an extra loan that caters for accommodation students will not have debt on their shoulders as soon as they start university, and can start focusing on more important things like the education itself. If grants are scrapped, at least bring something new and realistic to the table? This way less students will be tied between going to university or not because of the expenses, and will have easier access to a higher education letting students from 'low income families' have a better chance.

attributes.action: Introduce realistic maximum time for DBS applications for people trying to work.
attributes.background: DBS disclosures are needed to protect vulnerable people, yet thousands of people with families are waiting months to start a job they have been offered. This causes detrimental effects to peoples health and well being and in some cases homelessness.
attributes.additional_details:
These stresses and strains caused to peoples livelihoods need to be dramatically reduced. Many people are waiting over 5 months (in some cases over 7) uncertain of when they can financially support themselves and their families.
Many applications made to the DBS are for roles within the health and social care sector, increasingly under pressure through lack of staff. 
The government should also consider that such delays in peoples wages also directly impacts upon income tax payments.

attributes.action: Stop allowing supermarkets to sell cheap alcohol.
attributes.background: The Pub Trade is dying, supermarkets are allowed to sell cheap alcohol which allows people to drink to excess and cause more stress on the NHS Police and other emergency services.  pubs are not allowed to do this by law.
attributes.additional_details:
All the major supermarkets are allowed to do the promotions i.e selling a litre of Vodka for aprox £15.
This stops people visiting bars and keeping them alive, pubs are being turned into shops and the community is losing out with having no where to go to celebrate birthdays etc.
We need to act now and save our pub's and clubs from disappearing .

attributes.action: Don't force hard working council tenants to pay more rent
attributes.background: George Osborne wants to enforce the law, that if you earn a household income of £30,000 or more (£40,000 in London) you will have to pay equivalent of the private renting sector as of April 2017. He describes it as the 'rich' will no longer have the privilege. Some rents will increase by 300%
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3149748/Osborne-ban-cheap-rents-middle-class-council-tenants-340-000-earning-30-000-pay-market-rate.html

I understand the cut backs are needed, however this is forcing hard working people out of their homes, becoming homeless or being forced onto benefits. The £30,000 household income should not fall into the category of the 'rich' (this is only £15,000 each!  Its encouraging not to work and earn more, but to earn less!

attributes.action: Require all computer operating systems have up/down scroll bar arrows.
attributes.background: For the past four years the Apple operating system, Mac OS X has had no up/down arrows on it's scroll bar. This was a none optional global change, so affects all software run in Mac OS X, even if it isn't Apple software. This causes difficulties for some disabled people and none disabled people too.
attributes.additional_details:
https://discussions.apple.com/thread/3196331?tstart=0
http://www.quicken.com/support/scrollbar-arrows-missing-using-quicken-lion-os
http://reverttosaved.com/2015/02/18/access-all-areas-why-even-apple-needs-to-rethink-regarding-accessibility/
https://discussions.apple.com/message/30209946#30209946
http://www.macworld.co.uk/news/mac/opinion-whats-wrong-mountain-lion-interface-3425603/

attributes.action: Exemption of the 3% tax levy on parents helping their children to buy a home.
attributes.background: Helping children to buy homes should not be taxed. The money being used by parents has already been taxed twice as salary and as savings. This law is morally corrupt.

attributes.action: Stop increasing the pension age.  Reverse it back to 62 and 67 now.
attributes.background: Action is urgently required.  there are few of us who feel able to work in their late 60's/mid 70's especially if their jobs have been stressful or physical.  Just how are we supposed to keep going and who is going to employ us.  Reverse this increase back to 62 and 67 now

attributes.action: Make an INDEPENDENT EU booklet - facts, figures, forecasts if we STAY + if we GO
attributes.background: The EU Referendum is producing a blizzard of numbers, claims, guesses - it is virtually impossible for voters to assess properly the facts as they stand, or to get a balanced set of forecasts on the implications of either result. Without this information, the public cannot be asked to make a choice.
attributes.additional_details:
An independently produced booklet, perhaps no bigger the governments already produced booklet on why we should vote to stay, can be quickly produced to present first the facts as they stand and then the general expert views on what are the implications for the country if we vote to stay and if we vote to go.
Without giving voters a proper opportunity to assess both the facts and the body of opinion for both options in order to make their informed choice, we undermine democracy itself.

attributes.action: Put a cap on the monthly rent payments for individuals in the UK
attributes.background: In the county of Dorset the average rent payment for an individual is £400 per month. If an individual is earning the minimum UK wage at £7.00, and working a 40 hour week, this means that almost 50% of their earnings are going towards paying their landlord.
attributes.additional_details:
Considering the high expense of life in general, including rates for food and living costs, car insurance, telephone bills and the other monthly expenditures, this means that tenants are paying a high rate for other important items.
Considering this, the base line is that we in the UK are LIVING TO WORK. This has to change.

My intention is that parliament puts a cap for landlords at 30% of a monthly wage based on minimum wage for tenants in each county.

attributes.action: stop medicines wastage, allow the re-use of returned medication to the  pharmacy
attributes.background: Every year millions of pounds is lost when medications are returned to the pharmacy for destruction by patients, care homes e.t.c. Some of the medication remains untouched. We have the ridiculous situation where medication that has left the premises and returned the next day has to be destroyed.
attributes.additional_details: The government should allow pharmaceutical bodies to have criteria which can be followed to allow some medication that has to be returned to pharmacies to be re-used thus saving millions of pounds firstly in destruction costs and secondly in the cost of the medication. In light of the recent financial crisis and the cash strapped NHS. These efficiency savings could be pumped back into the NHS. It is also and unethical scenario when there are people around the globe who cannot afford medications.

attributes.action: Make all military veterans pensions tax free after a minimum service period
attributes.background: All veterans currently pay income tax on their pensions after full active military service i.e 22 years.  This is then classed as a second income, and other job income taxed accordingly.

attributes.action: Support farmers,pay rural farm payments on time.
attributes.background: This badly organised system has caused suicide within the farming community,disrupting cash flow.
attributes.additional_details: Payment on time: farmers are the salt of the earth:why do we have to suffer, the worry of not being able to pay our debts,last minute decision to inform us: no information as to when payments will be made.Try to get any answers is impossible:

attributes.action: The gov to look at LED in all of it's buildings to save up to 90% on energy!
attributes.background: The government is very wasteful in all of its buildings or is very slow in the uptake of LED technology (Lighting) by just changing a light bulb they could save 90% on electricity. It's a simple process and a quick win for the electorate..less money to energy companies & more for the NHS!
attributes.additional_details: LED lighting compared to conventional lighting not only saves on maintenance but also has a better quality of light and is better for the environment, a conventional light bulb is 48watts and an LED equivalent is 6watts..huge consumption saving. for every lightbulb you change you will save around £20 per year....imagine ALL bulbs changed...payback is normally 6 months on one of these bulbs.

attributes.action: Law to change so credit agencies include private rental payments on credit files
attributes.background: There is a natural parallel between monthly rental and mortgage payments that should be recognised by c.r.a. Aiding (private rental)citizens to become home owners escaping the trap/insecurity of private rental aiding contentment optimism and happiness benefiting communities and our broader society.
attributes.additional_details: We have rented privately for 14 years, my partner a lecturer and I an artist. We have 2 children. We have paid our rent on time, in full every month of these 14 years. Each rental payment is a massive percentage of our monthly income, higher than a mortgage would demand. Still this has had no positive implication on our credit rating that has however been negatively impacted by any minimally late utility bill payments. All these years of paying excessive rental payments has only benefitted the landlords and has had no influence on our credit rating that may have allowed us to escape the trap we find ourselves in and find deserved consistency for our family.

attributes.action: Make vaping bans illegal and regulate vaping fluid ingredients.
attributes.background:
Vaping is much safer than smoking, and causes no unpleasant odour. If the ridiculous bans on vaping of many establishments was made illegal, many more smokers would make the switch.

Many vaping "pre-mix" fluids contain needless toxic ingredients for "a smoother vape" and should be regulated.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is for the good of public health.

If vaping indoors was a legal right, more people would invest in electronic cigarettes out of convenience alone. More people would make the switch and save the NHS millions in the long term, while nicotine tax would continue to provide government revenue.

Poor quality vaping fluids are the reason why people think vaping is unsafe. Pre-mix vaping fluids need only contain nicotine, base and flavour, as is already available but it should be the law.

attributes.action: We demand that the government guarantees adequate future funding for the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is in dire risk of future collapse, due primarily to the pressure of inadequate funding from the government. We ask this and future governments to guarantee that the NHS will continue to be a free and full health service, and to commit to funding levels set by an independent expert body.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-37331350

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-35653455

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/sep/10/hospitals-on-brink-of-collapse-say-health-chiefs

http://metro.co.uk/2016/09/11/nhs-is-at-tipping-point-as-hospitals-struggle-with-severe-lack-of-funds-6121127/

http://www.itv.com/news/2016-09-11/cash-strapped-hospitals-face-unpalatable-choices-over-care-levels-warns-nhs-chief/

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/08/25/glut-of-nhs-closures-ahead-warn-hospital-chiefs/

attributes.action: Treat Halls of Residence as commercial premises for TV licence purposes
attributes.background: Halls of residence are little more than self catering Hotels or Hostels.  Students share "Flats" with on average 8 other students. Although they have their own room (as they do at home and don't need their own licence).Yet every student has to pay for their own licence! This is an unfair system.
attributes.additional_details: A 50 bedroom hostel would pay £145.50 for the first 15 units and £145.50 for every 5 units after that. So its total cost would be £1164.00 which divided by 50 people is only £23.28 each per year. However in a 50 room hall of residence each student has to pay £145.50 because their rooms include receiving equipment/sockets, whether they use them or not. The total cost raised for the BBC is £7275 (more if paid in installments) If students can't have free TV then at least make the system fair.

attributes.action: Make cycling in groups of over 6 a road traffic offence.
attributes.background: In the country side all weekend we are fed up of cyclists using our narrow lanes in large groups, this is incredibly dangerous to other road users, cars, horse riders, etc. They have very little regard or consideration for other people using the road.
attributes.additional_details: Getting very fed up of large groups of cyclists road racing with no stewards and no road closures with very little regard for other road users. If groups were limited to groups of 6 passing them down narrow lanes would be much safer for all.

attributes.action: A public holiday if Team GB finish above China in the medals team at Rio 2016
attributes.background:
If Team GB finish above China in the medals table, we should have a day's public holiday in the UK to celebrate this.

3rd place is the highest Team GB has ever finished an Olympic Games on foreign soil (1st in London 1908), so if we can beat the Chinese and finish second this would be crazy.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/olympics/rio-2016/medals/countries

336 GB athletes at Rio 2016 
412 Chinese athletes at Rio 2016

1.357 billion - population of China
64 million - population of UK

attributes.action: Improve the morale of NHS working staff by reducing the disparity in wages
attributes.background: The morale of the working staff in the NHS is at an all time low ebb. So it's no surprise that they take little pleasure in going to work, and that enthusiasm is lacking. A committee is needed to balance the difference in wages and working conditions between the different tiers of the hierarchy.
attributes.additional_details: I have had firsthand experience in this matter, visiting hospitals once a month for the last 10 years for treatment. After speaking to numerous members of the nursing staff, it became apparent that a large majority were unhappy with the working conditions and the difference in pay between themselves and more senior doctors in the NHS. I wish for this matter to be discussed, and for the balancing of wages to be considered by a committee.

attributes.action: Ensure that every train has a guard.
attributes.background: It should be a condition of offering a franchise to a Train Operating Company that every train has a guard. This improves safety and service and is reassuring for the travelling public, especially the elderly, disabled, and passengers with young children.

attributes.action: Agree never to sell or give our NHS details to anyone outside the NHS.
attributes.background: Apparently this proposal is back again. There is a proposal to sell all our details to the private sector. This was defeated once and needs to be defeated again. Let's get it debated in Parliament.

attributes.action: Train more doctors.
attributes.background: To meet future demands for healthcare, whilst managing the hours worked by doctors, we need more doctors.  There are currently lots of talented people who want to train as doctors but can't because there are not enough places at medical schools.
attributes.additional_details: As well as increasing the number of training places available to people aged 18, the number of places available to people in their 20's (both with and without a first degree in another subject) should be significantly increased to improve access to medicine as a career.  Currently to secure a place at medical school you have to demonstate an excellent academic record, a committment to medicine and a track record of helping others, usually by the age of 17.

attributes.action: Teach sea safety in all costal schools.
attributes.background: We should make it mandatory for all costal schools to teach their pupils about sea safety, as they do in Australia, this information has the potential to save many many lives and should be taught in schools.
attributes.additional_details: Many people each year find themselves stuck in rip tides, most of which in this country have no idea of what a rip tide is, never mind what to do if ever caught in one, there is plenty of life saving information out there and without this information the worst could happen. In Australia most if not all children in costal school are taught about the dangers of the sea and how they could potentially avoid it, we should take note from this and apply it to our own schools, potentially saving lives.

attributes.action: Reduce the six week school holidays.
attributes.background: We are now in 2016 which is a different era from times gone by.  Parents work not every parent can rely on free childcare or assistance from grandparents.  When a child is away from school for such a long time it is a detriment to any educational development.
attributes.additional_details: Children go back to school forgetting what they have learned in the previous term.  Many children are not physically active and spend the six week holidays inactive.  Childcare is very expensive children expect to do activities which unfortunately very rarely are free.  Family life is stressful due to the time scale and general cost.  Holidays abroad double.  Time with family is important but we need to look at an agenda which helps parents rather than hinders.  If the holidays are going to continue there needs to be a scheme to aid parents.

attributes.action: Companies get tax benefits to sell recycled tech or parts rather than new tech
attributes.background: Every year, millions of tons of operational tech is thrown away. For example in Europe, the average phone is used for 1.5yrs before being swapped, but most actually last ~6yrs. If the tax system were changed, companies would be encouraged to promote reuse or recycling of old technology.
attributes.additional_details:
See
http://www.electronicstakeback.com/wp-content/uploads/Facts-and-Figures-on-E-Waste-and-Recycling.pdf

attributes.action: Eye specialist, Moorfields, should decide who is fit to drive not the DVLA.
attributes.background: An Easterman eye test is not as conclusive as the DVLA believe. Some people cannot pass one but are still considered fit to drive but the DVLA will not listen to the specialists. Organisations like Moorfields should be able to say who is fit to drive. They are the professionals.
